channel.title: Moparscape security?
channel.description:
So I noticed today that on Chrome it has this in front of the address:
[img]https://www.google.com/help/hc/images/chrome_14679_redhttps_en.png[/img]
The site uses SSL, but Google Chrome has detected either high-risk insecure content on the page or problems with the site’s certificate. Don’t enter sensitive information on this page. Invalid certificate or other serious https issues could indicate that someone is attempting to tamper with your connection to the site.
_____________
Does this mean that it's referring to teh links that people may post on the forums or is it something else?
Also there are a few server development (elitedemon is the only ne I can remember at the moment) that when you click the link it goes toa page saying that this is a phishing site.

item.title: Moparscape security?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you actually read the warning, it is because the site also has content on it that isn’t over HTTPS (like the ads, for example), that is all. The actual certificate is valid and strong, and your connection to and from the server are perfectly secure.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape security?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Its about topics and malicious downloads that happen here? Weird… now i know why it happens though

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape security?
item.dc:creator: @xI_c_E xI c E
item.description:
@xI_c_E wrote:

The connection is using SSL but some of the things on the page aren’t secured with SSL.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape security?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

I think the pictures are hosted on his website.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape security?
item.dc:creator: @Eddie_Crosswall Eddie Crosswall
item.description:
@Eddie_Crosswall wrote:

But what would cause that? o.0 I mean it is not directing to elitedemon.org supposedly I am just going to the topic that talks about it?

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape security?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

I know of the redirections of phishing warnings, I got that from elitedemon too and a few others. I also get that https when I enter https into the page. Don’t enter https into the page anymore then close your internet browser (I’m assuming it’s Google Chrome) and leave it closed overnight. Get online in the morning and go to http://moparisthebest.com/smf/ and it will load without the https warning.

Read full topic
